name: postListsIdSegments
description: Create a new segment in a specific list.

list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

body.description: Information about a specific list segment.

options.description: The [conditions of the segment](https://mailchimp.com/help/save-and-manage-segments/). Static and fuzzy segments don't have conditions.

conditions.description: Segment match conditions. There are multiple possible types, see the [condition types documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/alternative-schemas/#segment-condition-schemas).

oneOf.description: Segment by interaction with a specific campaign.

field.description: Segment by interaction with a specific campaign.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.
value.title: Segment Data

oneOf.title: Aim Segment

oneOf.description: Segment by interaction with an Automation workflow.

field.description: Segment by interaction with an Automation workflow.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: The status of the member with regard to the automation workflow. One of the following: has started the workflow, has completed the workflow, has not started the workflow, or has not completed the workflow.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: The web id for the automation workflow to segment against.
value.title: Segment Data

oneOf.title: Automation Segment

oneOf.description: Segment by poll activity.

field.description: Segment by poll activity.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: Members have/have not interacted with a specific poll in a Mailchimp email.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: The id for the poll.
value.title: Segment Operator

oneOf.title: Poll Activity Segment

oneOf.description: Segment by interaction with a campaign via Conversations.

field.description: Segment by interaction with a campaign via Conversations.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation. One of the following: has replied or has not replied.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.
value.title: Segment Data

oneOf.title: Conversation Segment

oneOf.description: Segment by a specific date field.

extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.
extra.title: Segment Extra Value

field.description: The type of date field to segment on: The opt-in time for a signup, the date the subscriber was last updated, or the date of their last ecomm purchase.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: When the event took place:  Before, after, is a specific date, is not a specific date, is blank, or is not blank.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.
value.title: Segment Data

oneOf.title: Date Segment

oneOf.description: Segment by use of a particular email client.

field.description: Segment by use of a particular email client.
field.title: Segment Field

op.description: The operation to determine whether we select clients that match the value, or clients that do not match the value.
op.title: Segment Operator

value.description: The name of the email client.
value.title: Segment Data

conditions.title: Segment Type

options.title: Conditions

static_segment.description: An array of emails to be used for a static segment. Any emails provided that are not present on the list will be ignored. Passing an empty array will create a static segment without any subscribers. This field cannot be provided with the options field.
static_segment.title: Static Segment

body.title: List

$ul: **_links**: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
**created_at**: The date and time the segment was created in ISO 8601 format.
**id**: The unique id for the segment.
**member_count**: The number of active subscribers currently included in the segment.
**options**: The conditions of the segment. Static segments (tags) and fuzzy segments don't have conditions.

**conditions**: Segment match conditions. There are multiple possible types, see the [condition types documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/alternative-schemas/#segment-condition-schemas).
**type**: The type of segment. Static segments are now known as tags. Learn more about [tags](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).
**updated_at**: The date and time the segment was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

$block: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

$ul: **detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
**instance**: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
**status**: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**type**: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.
